artciles.q: In parts of the processor, adders are used to calculate ____________
artciles.description: Adders are used to perform the operation of addition. Thus, in parts of the processor, adders are used to calculate addresses, table indices, increment and decrement operators, and similar operations.

artciles.q: Total number of inputs in a half adder is __________
artciles.description: from concept discription

artciles.q: Total number of inputs in a full adder is __________
artciles.description: from concept discription

artciles.q: In which operation carry is obtained?
artciles.description: In addition, carry is obtained

artciles.q: If A and B are the inputs of a half adder, the sum is given by __________?
artciles.description: If A and B are the inputs of a half adder, the sum is given by A XOR B, while the carry is given by A AND B.

artciles.q: If A and B are the inputs of a half adder, the carry is given by __________
artciles.description: If A and B are the inputs of a half adder, the carry is given by: A(AND)B,

artciles.q: If A, B and C are the inputs of a full adder then the sum is given by __________
artciles.description: If A, B and C are the inputs of a full adder then the sum is given by A XOR B XOR C

artciles.q: How many AND, OR and EXOR gates are required for the configuration of full adder?
artciles.description: There are 2 AND, 1 OR and 2 EXOR gates required for the configuration of full adder, provided using half adder. Otherwise, configuration of full adder would require 3 AND, 2 OR and 2 EXOR

artciles.q: Half subtractor is used to perform subtraction of ___________?
artciles.description: Half subtractor is a combinational circuit which is used to perform subtraction of two bits, namely minuend and subtrahend and produces two outputs, borrow and difference.

artciles.q: For subtracting 1 from 0, we use to take a _______ from neighbouring bits?
artciles.description: For subtracting 1 from 0, we use to take a borrow from neighbouring bits because carry is taken into consideration during addition process.

artciles.q: Let A and B is the input of a subtractor then the output will be ___________
artciles.description: The subtractor has two outputs BOROW and DIFFERENCE. Since, the difference output of a subtractor is given by AB’ + BA’ and this is the output of a XOR gate. So, the final difference output is AB’ + BA’.

artciles.q: Let A and B is the input of a subtractor then the borrow will be ___________?
artciles.description: The borrow of a subtractor is received through AND gate whose one input is inverted. On that basis the borrow will be (A’ AND B).

artciles.q: What does minuend and subtrahend denotes in a subtractor?
artciles.description: Minuend and subtrahend are the two bits of input of a subtractor. If A and B are the two inputs of a subtractor then A is called minuend and B as subtrahend.

artciles.q: Full subtractor is used to perform subtraction of ___________
artciles.description: Full subtractor is used to perform subtraction of 3 bits, namely minuend bit, subtrahend bit and borrow from the previous stage. However, it also produces 2 outputs BORROW and DIFFERENCE.

artciles.q: The full subtractor can be implemented using ___________?
option: Two XOR and an OR gates
Two half subtractors and an OR gate
Two multiplexers and an AND gate
artciles.description: A full subtractor has 3 input bits and two outputs bits BORROW and DIFFERENCE. The full subtractor can be implemented using two half subtractors and an OR gate.

artciles.q: The output of a subtractor is given by (if A, B and X are the inputs).
artciles.description: The difference output of a subtractor is given by (if A, B and X are the inputs) A XOR B XOR X.

artciles.q: What is the major difference between half-adders and full-adders?
option: Full-adders are made up of two half-adders
Full adders can handle double-digit numbers
Full adders have a carry input capability
artciles.description: from the concept discription

artciles.q: The binary subtraction of 0 – 0 = ?
artciles.description: The binary subtraction of 0 – 0 = 0. Thus, it’s difference is 0 as well as it’s borrow.

artciles.q: What are the two types of basic adder circuits?
artciles.description: There are two types of adder circuits: half-adder and full-adder. Half-Adder has 2 inputs while Full-Adder has 3 inputs. Whereas, both have two outputs SUM and CARRY.

artciles.q: When does the output of a NOR gate = 0?
option: Whenever a 0 is present at an input
Whenever a 1 is present at an input
artciles.description: Based on logic gate concept

artciles.q: For a 4-bit parallel adder, if the carry-in is connected to a logical HIGH, the result is ___________?
option: That carry-out will always be HIGH
A one will be added to the final result
artciles.description: For a 4-bit parallel adder, if the carry-in is connected to a logical HIGH, one will be added to the final result as a result because carry-in gives output as 1.

artciles.q: What distinguishes the look-ahead-carry adder?
option: It is slower than the ripple-carry adder
It is easier to implement logically than a full adder
It is faster than a ripple-carry adder
artciles.description: Based on concept
